Description: Fragment of clay or brown-yellowish plaster mask of a falcon face, with a fine and shiny outer surface painted red and black details: eyes (large black pupil surrounded by a red circle), black beak and eyebrows, and other red lines under and each side of the beak. Negative impression of a rough cloth inside with black traces (bitumen?). Probably cover of the mummy of a falcon.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (MD.3)
